Nerd Crossing was founded with a simple mission in mind: to provide the world with trustworthy technology support focused on customer service. They believe in the principles of giving back, and work in service of their vision to offer honest, high quality IT, web, marketing, and residential computer services.
Boys & Girls Club of El Sobrante

Board member and past Board President of the Boys and Girls Club of El Sobrante, CA.  Our mission is:To enable all young people, especially those who need us most, to reach their full potential as productive, caring, responsible citizens.

Chair for the Northern California Area Council, represents over 40 local Boys & Girls Clubs and 6 military Clubs in the region and is part of an important and powerful force in the Boys & Girls Club Movement.The Council provides the chief medium for securing and maintaining the interest and active participation of board volunteers in national and regional Boys & Girls Club affairs. The Area Council is frequently the channel through which ideas, suggestions and proposals flow to the National Council. Conversely, our Area Council is often called upon to implement the programs and initiatives needed to expand the philosophy and aims of Clubs nationwide.

Member of the Strategy and Architecture team that is responsible for the three year distributed technology roadmap for the Technology Infrastructure Services (TIS) division of Schwab. Responsible for translating the client’s business requirements into specific systems, applications or process designs for very large complex IT solutions. Currently the lead architect for a data center move and the Java Application Server virtualization strategy. Responsibilities include understanding industry best practices, evaluating new technologies, gathering requirements from internal Schwab groups and business partners, creating financial cost/benefits analysis (TCO), vendor engagements, and executive level presentations.

Principal Engineer for Development Services, an organization that supported Schwab software development and QA environments. Responsibilities included managing large-scale, multi-platform UNIX and Windows server environments, providing timely support of developer issues, and engineering technology solutions to support internal business partners

I've been working with Jim on a massive data center move project. Jim is faced with the classic problems architects have to deal with on big projects, especially balancing multiple stakeholder needs and concerns. Jim is doing an excellent job meeting the various (and often opposing) demands, requirements, and mandates that are coming from differnt groups within our company. He is open minded and understanding, he listens well, and he succeeds at finding ways to resolve seemingly intractable conflicts of interest. I'd be pleased to work with Jim on other big projects again and hope we get the chance.

summary: Entrepreneur and IT professional with 20+ years experience in the Financial Services and Computer industries.  Co-founder of Nerd Crossing, a start-up in the San Francisco Bay Area that focuses on delivering honest, high quality technology services to home users and small businesses.Led several cross-functional teams on multi-million dollar technology initiatives to simplify, cut costs, increase productivity and deliver complex IT solutions within budget and timeline.  Excel in fostering strong relationships with peers, vendors, and business partners.MBA graduate from University of Phoenix and BS in Electrical Engineering (Computers) from University of Southern California Board President of the Boys & Girls Club of El Sobrante. Management and oversight of three Club sites, 22 staff, 500 members, and $850,000 annual budgetOther Volunteer experience includes:  Board Chair for the BGCA Northern California Area Council (45 Clubs), Director for the Chamber of Commerce of El Sobrante, member of Engineers Without Borders (EWB-San Francisco) and Habitat for Humanity.Freelance photographerSpecialties: Extensive experience with a broad range of technologies including virtualization (VMWare), Web and J2EE applications (WebSphere, Weblogic, Apache), operating systems (Windows, Linux, UNIX), hardware (HP, IBM, Sun), development tooling (WSAD, Clearcase), and networking (TCP/IP, Cisco)
name: James T Hammack
